item.title: The secret behind OpenWhisk scalability
item.description: How is it possible for OpenWhisk to scale automatically and distribute workload in the cloud starting from simple functions, written in different programming languages? The secret lies in its internal architecture. For the end-user, all it takes is to send his code as a function to the “cloud”. A lot of things then happen internally. The function is assembled into an executor, called runtime. There are runtimes for Javascript, Python, Java, Go, and many other programming languages.
